title: TJ Cox
added: When Cox made an updated financial disclosure in 2019, it was discovered that he had failed to disclose business interests as a candidate in 2018.<ref name=":3" /><ref name=":0">{{Cite web|last=Tavlian|first=Alex|last2=|first2=|date=2019-05-12|title=Ethics complaint filed against Cox citing failed reporting of business ties|url=http://sjvsun.com/news/politics/ethics-complaint-filed-against-cox-citing-failed-reporting-of-business-ties/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-06-01|website=The San Joaquin Valley Sun|language=en-US}}</ref> It was also discovered that Cox failed to timely pay wages owed to three employees of Constellation Mines, a company where Cox was a director until early 2019.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web|last=Irby|first=Kate|date=August 21, 2019|title=California congressman took 2 years to pay wages he owed to Canadian workers|url=https://www.fresnobee.com/news/local/article234047417.html|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=}}</ref> These obligations were not disclosed when Cox ran for Congress in 2018.<ref name=":4" />

In March 2020, Cox voted against a bill that would require members of Congress to disclose tax liens.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Gligich|first=Daniel|date=2020-03-12|title=With $145k in unpaid taxes, Cox votes against bill to disclose liens, garnish wages|url=http://sjvsun.com/news/politics/facing-145k-in-unpaid-taxes-cox-votes-against-bill-to-disclose-liens-garnish-wages/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-06-22|website=The San Joaquin Valley Sun|language=en-US}}</ref> In January 2020, the IRS placed a tax lien on Cox for approximately $87,000 in unpaid income tax for 2016 and approximately $57,000 in unpaid income tax for 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Gligich|first=Daniel|title=IRS hits Cox with lien over $145k in unpaid income taxes|url=http://sjvsun.com/news/politics/irs-hits-cox-with-145k-lien-over-unpaid-income-taxes/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-06-22|website=The San Joaquin Valley Sun|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Yeager|first=Joshua|title=Cox, Valadao face questions in business dealings as race for 21st district heats up|url=https://www.visaliatimesdelta.com/story/news/2020/02/19/tj-cox-david-valadao-face-questions-business-dealings/4787198002/|access-date=2020-06-22|website=Visalia Times-Delta and Tulare Advance-Register|language=en}}</ref> Cox was also subject to a $50,000 IRS tax lien in 2017, which Cox claims was the result of his check being stuck to the back of someone else's payment.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Irby|first=Kate|date=April 16, 2019|title=Californiaâ€™s most vulnerable Democrat is still untangling his tax liens heading into 2020|url=https://www.sacbee.com/news/politics-government/capitol-alert/article229297509.html|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=}}</ref>

In March 2020, Cox voted against a bill that would require members of Congress to disclose tax liens.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Gligich|first=Daniel|date=2020-03-12|title=With $145k in unpaid taxes, Cox votes against bill to disclose liens, garnish wages|url=http://sjvsun.com/news/politics/facing-145k-in-unpaid-taxes-cox-votes-against-bill-to-disclose-liens-garnish-wages/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-06-22|website=The San Joaquin Valley Sun|language=en-US}}</ref> In January 2020, the IRS placed a tax lien on Cox for approximately $87,000 in unpaid income tax for 2016 and approximately $57,000 in unpaid income tax for 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Gligich|first=Daniel|title=IRS hits Cox with lien over $145k in unpaid income taxes|url=http://sjvsun.com/news/politics/irs-hits-cox-with-145k-lien-over-unpaid-income-taxes/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-06-22|website=The San Joaquin Valley Sun|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Yeager|first=Joshua|title=Cox, Valadao face questions in business dealings as race for 21st district heats up|url=https://www.visaliatimesdelta.com/story/news/2020/02/19/tj-cox-david-valadao-face-questions-business-dealings/4787198002/|access-date=2020-06-22|website=Visalia Times-Delta and Tulare Advance-Register|language=en}}</ref> Cox was also subject to a $50,000 IRS tax lien in 2017, which Cox claims was the result of his check being stuck to the back of someone else's payment.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Irby|first=Kate|date=April 16, 2019|title=California's most vulnerable Democrat is still untangling his tax liens heading into 2020|url=https://www.sacbee.com/news/politics-government/capitol-alert/article229297509.html|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=|website=}}</ref>

title: TJ Cox
added: In June 2020, amid COVID-19 lockdowns, Cox pushed to gain preferential access into [[Yosemite National Park]] over the July 4 weekend. He requested two vehicle passes from the U.S. Department of Interior. At the time, Yosemite was only dispersing vehicle passes via a public lottery system. His initial request to circumvent the lottery system was denied due to government ethics rules. When he changed the stated purpose of his visit from personal to professional, saying he would be conducting official business while at the park, he was granted the passes. During his visit to the park, he filmed a short video of himself hiking that he shared with a group called Backcountry Hunters & Anglers, a group that supported the [[Great American Outdoors Act]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Tavlian |first1=Alex |title=Cox under fire for pushing for special access to Yosemite on July 4 |url=http://sjvsun.com/news/politics/cox-under-fire-for-pushing-for-special-access-to-yosemite-on-july-4/ |accessdate=21 October 2020 |work=The San Joaquin Valley Sun |date=3 August 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Tavlian |first1=Alex |title=Washington watchdog hits Cox with complaint over Yosemite trip |url=http://sjvsun.com/news/politics/washington-watchdog-hits-cox-with-complaint-over-yosemite-trip/ |accessdate=21 October 2020 |work=The San Joaquin Valley Sun |date=26 August 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=California congressman pulled rank to get Yosemite tickets, emails indicate |url=https://www.mercurynews.com/2020/08/06/california-congressman-pulled-rank-to-get-yosemite-tickets-emails-indicate/ |accessdate=21 October 2020 |work=The Mercury News |date=6 August 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Irby |first1=Kate |title=Fresno Congressman TJ Cox used his office to skirt Yosemiteâ€™s lottery for car passes, emails show |url=https://www.fresnobee.com/news/politics-government/article244710057.html |accessdate=21 October 2020 |publisher=Fresno Bee |date=August 4, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Moffitt |first1=Mike |title=Fresno congressman bypassed lottery to get July 4 Yosemite passes, emails show |url=https://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/Fresno-congressman-bypassed-lottery-to-get-July-4-15464921.php |accessdate=21 October 2020 |work=SFGate |date=6 August 2020}}</ref>
